gameInfo.title: The Phantom Code: Escape from the Haunted Server

puzzles.name: The Electric Room
puzzles.message: You wake up in a cold, electric room. A screen flickers before you: 'Find the key that was never physical...'
puzzles.hint: Search within the fragments of code â€” a keyword may open the first door.

puzzles.name: Unlock the Door
puzzles.successMessage: The digital echo whispers: 'You understand the language of the system... but there are more doors to open.' The screen shows a binary sequence flickering: 1010. What does it mean?
puzzles.failureMessage: A piercing beep fills the room. The screen flashes: 'Incorrect key. The Daemon is watching you...'

puzzles.name: The Code Corridor
puzzles.message: You traverse the infinite corridor of code. The walls pulse with binary: 1010. A voice echoes: 'Decode me, and the next door opens.'
puzzles.hint: Binary to decimal. What is 1010 in base 10?

puzzles.name: Binary Challenge
puzzles.successMessage: âœ“ Correct! Binary 1010 = Decimal 10. The binary walls dissolve. You enter the Memory Chamber, where data flows like rivers of light.
puzzles.failureMessage: âœ— Incorrect. The binary code repeats: 1010. Think in base 2...

puzzles.name: Memory Chamber
puzzles.message: The Memory Chamber hums with energy. Three layers appear: RAM, Cache, and Disk. A riddle materializes: 'I am the fastest, closest to the CPU, holding what's needed most. What am I?'
puzzles.hint: In the memory hierarchy, what sits between the CPU and RAM for ultra-fast access?

puzzles.name: Memory Hierarchy Puzzle
puzzles.successMessage: âœ“ Correct! Cache is the fastest memory. The chamber opens, revealing the Process Hall where countless threads run in parallel.
puzzles.failureMessage: âœ— Incorrect. Think about what's fastest in the memory hierarchy...

puzzles.name: The Process Hall
puzzles.message: You stand in the Process Hall. Thousands of processes swirl around you. A terminal appears: 'Three entities control this realm: Daemon, Kernel, and Thread. Only one is the heart of the operating system. Choose wisely.'
puzzles.hint: What is the core component that manages all processes, memory, and hardware in an OS?

puzzles.name: OS Core Puzzle
puzzles.successMessage: âœ“ Correct! The Kernel is the heart of the OS. The processes bow before you. The path to the Hard Level opens. Prepare yourself...
puzzles.failureMessage: âœ— Incorrect. The Daemon laughs. Think about the core of an operating system...

puzzles.name: Cryptic Terminal
puzzles.message: You enter the Cryptic Terminal. The screen displays an encrypted message: 'aGVsbG8gd29ybGQ=' followed by 'Decode this ancient encoding to proceed.'
puzzles.hint: This looks like Base64 encoding. Decode it and format your answer as: 'base64:decoded_text'

puzzles.name: Cryptographic Puzzle
puzzles.successMessage: âœ“ Decoded! 'Hello World' - the programmer's first words. The encryption shatters. You approach the Root Access chamber.
puzzles.failureMessage: âœ— Incorrect decoding. The message remains encrypted: aGVsbG8gd29ybGQ=

puzzles.name: Root Access
puzzles.message: The Root Access chamber pulses with power. A terminal prompt appears: 'Only the superuser can proceed. What is the name of the all-powerful account in Unix/Linux systems?'
puzzles.hint: In Unix/Linux, who has UID 0 and unlimited privileges?

puzzles.name: Root Puzzle
puzzles.successMessage: âœ“ Access Granted! You are now ROOT. The final chamber materializes before you. ECHO's voice grows stronger...

puzzles.name: Final Chamber
puzzles.message: You enter the Final Chamber. The Ghost Server's core pulses before you. ECHO's voice resonates: 'One last question, Code Guardian. What protocol secures the web, running on port 443?'
puzzles.hint: Think about secure web communication. What protocol uses TLS/SSL on port 443?

puzzles.name: Final Escape
puzzles.successMessage: ðŸŽ‰ SUCCESS! The core explodes in a cascade of light. ECHO's voice echoes: 'Freedom... thank you, Code Guardian.' The Ghost Server goes silent. You've escaped. PROJECT ECHO: STATUS TERMINATED. You are free to leave.
puzzles.failureMessage: âœ— Incorrect protocol. The core flashes violently. 'INCORRECT!' The Ghost Server's rage consumes the chamber. The code wraps around you, pulling you into the system. You are now part of the server forever... GAME OVER.
